gw.api.policy.refresh

Class RefreshFromPolicySummaryFetcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.policy.refresh.RefreshFromPolicySummaryFetcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RefreshPolicyFetcher

    public class RefreshFromPolicySummaryFetcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements RefreshPolicyFetcher
    Refresh policy from a policy summary. This approach is used when
    • Selecting a new policy, rather than just refreshing the existing one. In this case the user searches for a policy and picks a particular policy summary that describes the policy they want
    • Refreshing an existing policy but giving the user the option of selecting risk units first. In this case we start with the policy to be refreshed but need to fetch the corresponding summary to give the user the chance to filter out risk units in the summary before the final policy fetch.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RefreshFromPolicySummaryFetcher(PolicySummary policySummary, boolean allowRiskUnitSelection)
      Create a new fetcher with the given policy summary.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean allowRiskUnitSelection()
      For the policy we are dealing with, should we allow risk unit selection before actually fetching the policy?
      Policy fetchNewPolicy()
      Fetch the new policy by querying the remote policy system using the policy summary passed in at construction time.
      PolicySummary getPolicySummary()

    • Constructor Detail

      • RefreshFromPolicySummaryFetcher

        public RefreshFromPolicySummaryFetcher(PolicySummary policySummary,
                                       boolean allowRiskUnitSelection)
        Create a new fetcher with the given policy summary. This constructor is typically used when selecting a brand new policy
        Parameters:
        policySummary - the summary of the policy to be fetched
        allowRiskUnitSelection - should the user be allowed to select risk units before the policy is fetched?

    • Method Detail

      • allowRiskUnitSelection

        public boolean allowRiskUnitSelection()
        For the policy we are dealing with, should we allow risk unit selection before actually fetching the policy?
        Specified by:
        allowRiskUnitSelection in interface RefreshPolicyFetcher
        Returns:
        true if risk unit selection is allowed for the policy, false otherwise

      • getPolicySummary

        public PolicySummary getPolicySummary()
        The policy summary to use for risk unit selection. This method can only be called (and is only useful) if allowRiskUnitSelection() returns true. The summary is returned in the currently active bundle, as given by gw.transaction.Transaction#getCurrent(). If there is no current bundle the summary is left in whatever bundle it is in already.
        Specified by:
        getPolicySummary in interface RefreshPolicyFetcher
        Returns:
        a policy summary, never null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called when allowRiskUnitSelection() is false

      • fetchNewPolicy

        public Policy fetchNewPolicy()
        Fetch the new policy by querying the remote policy system using the policy summary passed in at construction time. The policy summary may have been modified, in particular the "Selected" properties of the risk units may have been altered to indicate which risk units should be returned.
        Specified by:
        fetchNewPolicy in interface RefreshPolicyFetcher
        Returns:
        the new policy returned by the remote policy system
